intro: Uragoga angustata, commonly known as the narrowleaf uragoga, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
